page.title: 16THE JONES
page.content: Stuart Jones is a member of a family of seven which is unusual this days. Mr Jones is a builder and his wife stays at home but takes an active part in local affairs and school life - she teaches netball. Sunday begins with a lie in followed by a cooked breakfast. The children and their mother go to Llanbedr Church for the 10.30 service. Dad stays at home to read the newspaper. Lunch is often salad on a sunday. Later they watch cartoons on the television and after that they go outside to play. Sunday tea is special with jelly, icecream and so on. Sunday evenings find most of the family either having a bath or preparing for school the next morning, so bedtime is earlier on sundays.
